SqlQueryStrings.SqlQueryString: select RQ.[Requested_Query_ID] as ID,RQ.[Request_ID] as 'Request ID',RQ.[QueryID] as 'Query ID' ,RQ.[ExecutionOrder] as 'Ex Order', RQ.[ExecutionStatus] as 'Execution Status', US.UserName as 'Executed User', RQ.[ExecutedDate] as 'Executed Date', RQ.[QueryString] as 'Query' ,QT.QueryType as 'Query Type', DB.DBName as 'Database', QR.QueryName as 'QueryName' from [dbo].[PM_Requested_Queries] RQ left outer join PM_Users US on US.User_Id = RQ.ExecutedBy inner join PM_Queries QR on RQ.QueryID = QR.QueryId inner join PM_QueryTypes QT on QT.QueryTypeId = QR.QueryTypeId inner join PM_Request RS on RS.Request_Id = RQ.Request_ID inner join PM_Requiremenet RQQ on RS.Requirement_Id = RQQ.RequirementId inner join PM_Databases DB on RQQ.DB_Id = DB.DB_Id where RQ.Request_ID = @RequestID order by RQ.ExecutionOrder
update PM_Requested_Queries set ExecutedBy = @LoggedUserId, ExecutedDate = GETDATE(), ExecutionStatus = 1 where Requested_Query_ID = @RequestedQueryId

select COUNT(RQ.Requested_Query_ID) as RQCount from PM_Request RS inner join PM_Requested_Queries RQ on RS.Request_Id = RQ.Requested_Query_ID where RQ.ExecutionStatus = 0 and RS.Request_Id = @RequestId
update PM_Request set Execution_Status = 1 where Request_Id = @RequestId

SELECT Col.Column_Name from INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLE_CONSTRAINTS Tab, INFORMATION_SCHEMA.CONSTRAINT_COLUMN_USAGE Col WHERE Col.Constraint_Name = Tab.Constraint_Name AND Col.Table_Name = Tab.Table_Name AND Constraint_Type = 'PRIMARY KEY' AND Col.Table_Name = @PrimaryTable
